concise_definition: v. 爬行, 抢夺, 混乱地处理; n. 混乱争夺, 爬行

definitions.explanation_en: To move quickly and awkwardly, typically using hands and knees, especially when climbing or getting up from a low position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手和膝盖快速而笨拙地移动，通常用于攀爬或从低处起身。
definitions.example_en: The children were scrambling up the hill to get a better view.
definitions.example_cn: 孩子们正手脚并用地爬上山坡，想看得更清楚。

definitions.explanation_en: To struggle or compete urgently for something limited or desirable, often in a disorganized way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为争夺有限或珍贵的事物而激烈、无序地竞争。
definitions.example_en: Shoppers were scrambling for the last discounted items on Black Friday.
definitions.example_cn: 购物者们在黑色星期五争抢最后的打折商品。

definitions.explanation_en: To mix or combine things hastily and without order, often resulting in confusion or a jumbled outcome.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指匆忙而无序地混合或组合事物，常导致混乱或杂乱的结果。
definitions.example_en: The reporter was scrambling notes from several sources to finish the story.
definitions.example_cn: 记者匆忙整理来自多个消息源的笔记，以完成报道。

definitions.explanation_en: A hurried, disorganized effort to obtain or achieve something, often in a competitive context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在竞争环境中为获得或实现某物而进行的匆忙、无序的努力。
definitions.example_en: There was a scramble for seats when the concert tickets went on sale.
definitions.example_cn: 演唱会门票开售时，人们争相抢座。

comparison.analysis: “Climbing” (攀爬) 通常指有目的、有节奏地向上移动，强调垂直方向和技巧性，如攀岩或爬树。而 “scrambling” 更强调笨拙、无序、依赖四肢的快速移动，常用于不规则地形，动作更杂乱。
“Rushing” (匆忙赶路) 强调速度和紧迫感，但不一定涉及身体动作的复杂性或竞争性。而 “scrambling” 不仅包含速度，还隐含混乱、争夺或手忙脚乱的物理动作，常用于资源有限的场景。
“Jumbling” (杂乱堆放) 通常指物体被无序地混在一起，多用于静态结果。而 “scrambling” 作为动词时强调动态的、主动的混乱行为，如抢夺或匆忙整理，具有更强的动作性和目的性。
